location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter from Lieutenant-Colonel Samuel Hennell, Resident in the Persian Gulf, Bushire to Commodore John Patterson Porter, Commander of the Indian Naval Squadron in the Persian Gulf

mods.abstract: Samuel Hennell requests that an accompanying bag containing 600 German crowns be forwarded by the HC steam frigate Aucklandto Lieutenant James Tronson, Commander of the HC brig Euphrates, who is to be instructed to deliver the bag to the Native Agent at Shargah [Sharjah], Moollah Houssein [Mullah Husain]. Hennell further requests that Tronson examine the islands of Surdy [Sirrī] and Seir Abonsid [Şīr Bū Nu‘ayr] in order to ascertain whether or not the pirate, Soheil ben Ateish, is lurking in those quarters.
